document.title: The University of Tennessee Cherokee Farm Master Plan

field.name: comments
field.value: The University of Tennessee will develop the 200-acre Cherokee Farm property as a state-of-the-art science and technology research campus focused on solving problems of national significance. Located in Knoxville, Tennessee, the Cherokee Farm Campus lies immediately southwest of and across the Tennessee River from the University systemâ€™s flagship campus in downtown Knoxville. Accordingly, the development of the Cherokee Farm Campus presents two compelling and interrelated opportunities: establishing a unique place for world class research while becoming a dynamic new asset in the city of Knoxville.
